title: Snapper Piccata
summary: Snapper Piccata might be just the main course you are searching for. Watching your figure? This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe has 229 calories, 35g of protein, and 6g of fat per serving. For $3.38 per serving, this recipe covers 23% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. 1 person found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. Head to the store and pick up salt, capers, wine, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the dry white wine you could follow this main course with the White Wine Frozen Yogurt as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 90%, this dish is great. Try Cod Piccata, Chicken Piccata, and Chicken Piccata for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: A pale straw yellow. Clean, crisp fragrance with intense yet elegant hints of quince. Fresh, harmonious fruit set off by slight sweetness with a long finish full of delicate, tangy flavor.

instructions: Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle fillets evenly with salt and pepper. Add fillets to pan, and cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until fillets flake easily when tested with a fork. Remove fillets from pan; keep warm.                                                                                                 Add wine and juice to pan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer 2 minutes or until slightly thick, scraping pan to loosen browned bits. Stir in capers and parsley. Spoon sauce evenly over fillets.                                                                                                Serve with: Parsley-Buttered Pasta

steps.step: Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Sprinkle fillets evenly with salt and pepper.
Add fillets to pan, and cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until fillets flake easily when tested with a fork.
Remove fillets from pan; keep warm.

Add wine and juice to pan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer 2 minutes or until slightly thick, scraping pan to loosen browned bits. Stir in capers and parsley. Spoon sauce evenly over fillets.
